engineering_design_principles.mechanism: The double helix structure compacts genetic information, provides stability through hydrogen bonds between base pairs, and ensures efficient storage and transmission of information.
The helical shape, resembling a spiral staircase or twisted ladder, optimizes the structure for efficient packaging of long DNA molecules within cells.

The use of hydrogen bonds to connect complementary base pairs (A-T and C-G) ensures precise pairing and sequencing of nucleotides, providing a mathematical framework for encoding and decoding genetic information.
The helical shape of the double helix structure facilitates the transport and manipulation of DNA molecules within cells, and ensures robustness, scalability, and fault-tolerance.
